com.smartnsoft.droid4me.app

Class AbstractSmartListActivity<AggregateClass,BusinessObjectClass,ListViewClass extends android.view.ViewGroup,ViewClass extends android.view.View>

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • android.view.ContextThemeWrapper
          • android.app.Activity
            • com.smartnsoft.droid4me.app.SmartActivity<AggregateClass>
              • com.smartnsoft.droid4me.app.AbstractSmartListActivity<AggregateClass,BusinessObjectClass,ListViewClass,ViewClass>
  • Type Parameters:
    AggregateClass - the aggregate class accessible though the SmartActivity.setAggregate(Object) and SmartActivity.getAggregate() methods
    BusinessObjectClass - the business objects being handled
    ListViewClass - the @{link ViewGroup} implementation class for the list view widget
    ViewClass - the View representation of the business objects
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory2, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.Window.Callback, AppPublics.LifeCyclePublic, Smartable<AggregateClass>, SmartableActivity<AggregateClass>, Smarted<AggregateClass>, DetailsProvider.ForList<BusinessObjectClass,ViewClass>, DetailsProvider.ForListHandler<BusinessObjectClass>, DetailsProvider.ForListView<BusinessObjectClass,ViewClass>, LifeCycle, WrappedListView.OnEventObjectListener<BusinessObjectClass>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractWrappedSmartListActivity, SmartListActivity
    Deprecated.

    @Deprecated
public abstract class AbstractSmartListActivity<AggregateClass,BusinessObjectClass,ListViewClass extends android.view.ViewGroup,ViewClass extends android.view.View>
extends SmartActivity<AggregateClass>
implements DetailsProvider.ForList<BusinessObjectClass,ViewClass>, WrappedListView.OnEventObjectListener<BusinessObjectClass>
    In order to propose a list activity which automates many things regarding its underlying business objects.
    Since:
    2008.04.04
    Author:
    Ã‰douard Mercier

      • onRetrieveDisplayObjects

        public void onRetrieveDisplayObjects()
        Deprecated. 
        Description copied from interface: LifeCycle
        This is the place where the derived class should set its layout, extract all widgets which require a further customization and store them as instance attributes. This method is invoked only once during the entity life cycle.

        The method is invoked:

        • for an Activity, during the Activity#onCreate() execution, after the parent Activity#onCreate() method has been invoked ;
        • for an Fragment, during the Fragment#onCreate() execution, after the parent Fragment#onCreate() method has been invoked.

        It is ensured that this method will be invoked from the UI thread!

        Never invoke this method, only the framework should, because this is a callback!

        Specified by:
        onRetrieveDisplayObjects in interface LifeCycle

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled(BusinessObjectClass businessObject)
        Deprecated. 
        Specified by:
        isEnabled in interface DetailsProvider.ForListHandler<BusinessObjectClass>
        Returns:
        true if the business object is enabled (can be selected)

      • onRetrieveBusinessObjects

        public void onRetrieveBusinessObjects()
                               throws LifeCycle.BusinessObjectUnavailableException
        Deprecated. 
        When overriding this method, you must invoke the super class method.
        Specified by:
        onRetrieveBusinessObjects in interface LifeCycle
        Throws:
        LifeCycle.BusinessObjectUnavailableException - if the extraction of the business objects was a failure and that this issue cannot be recovered, this enables to notify the framework that the current entity cannot continue its execution

      • onBusinessObjectsRetrieved

        public void onBusinessObjectsRetrieved()
        Deprecated. 
        When overriding this method, you must invoke the super class method.
        Specified by:

        Overrides:
        onBusinessObjectsRetrieved in class SmartActivity<AggregateClass>

      • onFulfillDisplayObjects

        public void onFulfillDisplayObjects()
        Deprecated. 
        Description copied from interface: LifeCycle
        This is the place where the implementing class can initialize the previously retrieved graphical objects. This method is invoked only once during the entity life cycle.

        If the entity does not implement the LifeCycle.BusinessObjectsRetrievalAsynchronousPolicy interface, the method is invoked during the:

        1. Activity.onResume() execution for the Activity, after the parent Activity.onResume() method has been invoked,
        2. Fragment.onResume() execution for the Fragment, after the parent Fragment.onResume() method has been invoked.
        If the entity implements the LifeCycle.BusinessObjectsRetrievalAsynchronousPolicy interface, this method will be invoked just after the LifeCycle.onRetrieveBusinessObjects() method first invocation has successfully returned.

        It is ensured that this method will be invoked from the UI thread!

        Never invoke this method, only the framework should, because this is a callback!

        Specified by:
        onFulfillDisplayObjects in interface LifeCycle

      • onSynchronizeDisplayObjects

        public void onSynchronizeDisplayObjects()
        Deprecated. 
        Description copied from interface: LifeCycle
        This method is supposed to update the display objects that may need some refreshing due to the underlying business objects that may have changed. It will be invoked a first time once the entity has successfully fulfilled its display objects, and every time the LifeCycle.refreshBusinessObjectsAndDisplay(boolean, Runnable, boolean) method is invoked, provided the previous LifeCycle.onRetrieveBusinessObjects() callback has successfully executed.

        When the method is invoked the first time, it will be called just after the LifeCycle.onFulfillDisplayObjects() callback execution.

        It is ensured that this method will be invoked from the UI thread!

        Never invoke this method, only the framework should, because this is a callback!

        Specified by:
        onSynchronizeDisplayObjects in interface LifeCycle

      • notifyBusinessObjectsChanged

        public final void notifyBusinessObjectsChanged(boolean businessObjectCountAndSortingUnchanged)
        Deprecated. 
        Call this method when you want the list display to be recomputed because its underlying business object list has changed.
        Parameters:
        businessObjectCountAndSortingUnchanged - set to true when either the business objects count and order have been unchanged, and just the data changed

      • refreshBusinessObjectsAndDisplayAndNotifyBusinessObjectsChanged

        public final void refreshBusinessObjectsAndDisplayAndNotifyBusinessObjectsChanged(boolean businessObjectCountAndSortingUnchanged)
        Deprecated. 
        Forces the retrieving of the business objects list, and eventually asks to the underlying list UI to refresh.
        Parameters:
        businessObjectCountAndSortingUnchanged - set to true when either the business objects count and order have been unchanged, and just the data changed
        See Also:
        notifyBusinessObjectsChanged(boolean), #refreshBusinessObjectsAndDisplay(boolean)
